text:
Profound papilledema due to cryptococcal meningitis in acquired immunodeficiency syndrome: successful treatment with fluconazole.
 Although cryptococcal meningitis is a frequent infection in patients with AIDS, papilledema is rarely reported.
 We have reported a case of profound papilledema associated with cryptococcal meningitis in a patient with AIDS.
 After treatment failure with amphotericin B, the patient was successfully treated with fluconazole, and the papilledema resolved.
